body: is it possible to remove the version so there will be no need to maintain that?

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+{
+  "name": "bootstrap-social",
+  "version": "4.9.0",
body:
Sadly, I don't think that can be done: https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#version

Are you only git tagging when releasing at the moment? If so, there is the `npm version` command that updates the `package.json` with the new version and git tags automatically at once: https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/version
where did you get this color?! source?

I got it from the WhatsApp symbol here:

http://media.whatsapp.com/logos/Vector
Hm...i see gradient on this logos :)

body: there is no underscore.. and we should then the *.less as well.. if so. split the array in multiple lines..

diff_hunk:

-  "main": "bootstrap-social.css",

body:
Just follow the rest of the style.. and sort the alphabetically..

``` json
"main": [
  "bootstrap-social.css",
  "bootstrap-social.less",
  "bootstrap-social.scss"
],
```

-  "main": "bootstrap-social.css",

+           "bootstrap-social.scss",
+           "bootstrap-social.less"],
body: Now it's OK.

Color literals like `#1074a8` should only be used in variable declarations; they should be referred to via variable everywhere else.
Opening curly brace `{` should be preceded by one space
I've followed the pattern in existing rules.
